content.description: Rosewood is a classic route that sends the headwall's center face. This route has a great variety of holds with the crux being the upper section of the face using some excellent crimpers.
content.location: Follow the single track trail from the main wash up towards the base of Rosewood wall. The route beings at the base of the wall. Bolts will be visible.Â

content.description: Rosewood is a secluded area that is tucked away from the main wash of McKelligon Canyon. It was initially listed in the Franklin Mountain Range Climbers Guidebook (2010). The main Rosewood wall is a fairly flat vertical face with a variety of rock features. Great spot for top rope climbing.
